vsync

Class ValueSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • vsync.ValueSender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VSyncConstants

    public class ValueSender
extends Object
implements VSyncConstants
    The ValueSender is used to synchronize values from the Processing sketch to the Arduino. If you have a variable in your sketch -- for example the x coordinate of your mouse mouseX -- you can use ValueSender to synchronize it to your Arduino. The SimpleSender example shows you the minimal steps to get going.

      • Fields inherited from interface vsync.VSyncConstants

    • Constructor Detail

      • ValueSender

        public ValueSender(PApplet parent,
           Serial serial)
        Creates a new instance of a ValueSender using a given Serial interface.
        Parameters:
        parent - The PApplet you want to attach to.
        serial - The Serial you want to use for communication.

    • Method Detail

      • pre

        public void pre()

      • observe

        public ValueSender observe(String variable)
        Starts the observation of a new variable. Whenever the variable changes it is updated on the Arduino too. The variable should be declared publicand must be of type int!
        Parameters:
        The - name of the variable to observe.

      • variableChanged

        public boolean variableChanged(int index)
        Checks if a variable changed since the last sync.
        Parameters:
        index - The index (depending on the order of the observe() call) of the variable to check.
        Returns:
        Whether the variable changed or not.
